[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@here/harp-mapview](./harp-mapview.md) &gt; [MapView](./harp-mapview.mapview.md) &gt; [setElevationSource](./harp-mapview.mapview.setelevationsource.md)

## MapView.setElevationSource() method

Sets the DataSource which contains the elevations, the elevation range source, and the elevation provider. Only a single elevation source is possible per \[\[MapView\]\]

If the terrain-datasource is merged with this repository, we could internally construct the \[\[ElevationRangeSource\]\] and the \[\[ElevationProvider\]\] and access would be granted to the application when it asks for it, to simplify the API.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
setElevationSource(elevationSource: DataSource, elevationRangeSource: ElevationRangeSource, elevationProvider: ElevationProvider): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  elevationSource | [DataSource](./harp-mapview.datasource.md) | The datasource containing the terrain tiles. |
|  elevationRangeSource | [ElevationRangeSource](./harp-mapview.elevationrangesource.md) | Allows access to the elevation min / max per tile. |
|  elevationProvider | [ElevationProvider](./harp-mapview.elevationprovider.md) | Allows access to the elevation at a given location or a ray from the camera. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;
